New Records: Glenn Phillips scored a 104 off 64 deliveries, the second-hundred of the tournament and the second hundred in T20Is for the Kiwi man
Key Match Events: New Zealand beat Sri Lanka by 65 runs in their ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2022 clash
Finn Allen, Devon Conway, and Kane Williamson were all sent back cheaply, leaving New Zealand three down inside the Powerplay
Glenn Phillips and Daryl Mitchell worked well together, putting 84 runs together in the next 10.5 overs
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Phillips said his century was the most special innings of his short-form career so far
He attributed the team's win to a 'overall team effort'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Glenn Phillips' innings was both special and unusual, with 40 of his runs coming from running between the wickets
He reached the boundary 14 times in the knock, with ten fours and a quartet of maximums
The long boundaries, slow outfields, and tricky surface contributed to the unusual occurrence
Others: Glenn Phillips talked through much of his knock in occasionally hilarious fashion, comments that were intentionally picked up on the stump mic
He said it's always his intention to give the fans some joy and to enjoy the game as much as possible
